content: This is a somewhat frivolous question, but I guess it should be settled: what name should we give the nice tool we now have at https://teorth.github.io/equational_theories/implications/ to explore the implication graph? (Many thanks, by the way, to @Nicholas Carlini for setting it all up!) The working name is "Advanced Equation Implication Table", but I've been referring to it as "Equation Explorer" now that it has the functionality to move from one equation to another. Anyone else have some catchy name proposals for this tool (which I am hoping will become increasingly sophisticated as time goes on, with many useful features attached to it)? Once we have a few candidates I could set up a poll to determine what to call it.
Uh, I didn't even realize it had a title ... claude wrote most of the boilerplate, so you can safely ignore that title as having zero human votes
On the contrary, we should definitely mention this in the "impacts of AI assistance" section of the eventual article :)
The home page currently names the tool "Equation Viewer".

/poll What to name the equation tool?
Equifax
Equation explorer
Equation viewer
Looks like we have consensus! The tool has now been officially renamed "Equation Explorer".
Terence Tao has marked this topic as resolved.
